com.neebal.android.simplyreliable.message.resthttp

Class PostMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.neebal.android.simplyreliable.message.Message
      • com.neebal.android.simplyreliable.message.OutMessage
        • com.neebal.android.simplyreliable.message.resthttp.PayLoadMessage
          • com.neebal.android.simplyreliable.message.resthttp.PostMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class PostMessage
extends PayLoadMessage
implements Serializable
    Represents an OutMessage with the method type as POST that will be sent to the server. This message instance is used to 'post' data to the server that will lead to the creation of a new resource at the server side. This message will have the payload data that needs to be sent in the request.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Neebal Technologies
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Note: This PostMessage instance will be synchronous in nature

      Note: This PostMessage instance will be asynchronous in nature

      Note: This PostMessage instance will be asynchronous in nature
      PostMessage(Resource resourcePath, Serializable messageBody, Type responseType, StreamingResponseCallback callback)
      Creates PostMessage instance initialized with the resource path and the message body that needs to be sent in the message.

      Note: This PostMessage instance will be asynchronous in nature
      PostMessage(Type responseType)
      Creates PostMessage instance using only the responseType.
      PostMessage(Type responseType, SimplyReliableMsgIntf callback)
      Creates PostMessage instance using the responseType and a callback This will initialize the instance with null resourcePath and null serializable message body.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PostMessage

        public PostMessage(Resource resourcePath,
           Serializable messageBody,
           Type responseType,
           SimplyReliableMsgIntf callback)
        Creates PostMessage instance initialized with the resource path and the message body that needs to be sent in the message.

        Note: This PostMessage instance will be asynchronous in nature
        Parameters:
        resourcePath - the path to the resource
        messageBody - the body containing the data of the new resource that needs to be created
        responseType - a response Type instance representing the entire response structure that is expected out of this post request.
        e.g. Type responseType = new TypeToken<Foo<Bar>>() {}.getType(); if we expect the json response to be unmarshalled back to the class Foo<Bar>
        callback - the callback on which the methods will be called after getting the response/error response from the server

      • PostMessage

        public PostMessage(Type responseType)
        Creates PostMessage instance using only the responseType. This will initialize the instance with null resourcePath and null serializable message body.

        Note: This could be useful for cases where a particular message depends upon another message for its resource path and serializable message body.
        This PostMessage instance will be synchronous in nature
        Parameters:
        responseType - a response Type instance representing the entire response structure that is expected out of this post request.
        e.g. Type responseType = new TypeToken<Foo<Bar>>() {}.getType(); if we expect the json response to be unmarshalled back to the class Foo<Bar>

      • PostMessage

        public PostMessage(Type responseType,
           SimplyReliableMsgIntf callback)
        Creates PostMessage instance using the responseType and a callback This will initialize the instance with null resourcePath and null serializable message body.

        Note: This could be useful for cases where a particular message depends upon another message for its resource path and serializable message body.
        This PostMessage instance will be asynchronous in nature
        Parameters:
        responseType - a response Type instance representing the entire response structure that is expected out of this post request.
        e.g. Type responseType = new TypeToken<Foo<Bar>>() {}.getType(); if we expect the json response to be unmarshalled back to the class Foo<Bar>
        callback - the callback on which the methods will be called after getting the response/error response from the server

    • Method Detail

      • executeServerCall

        public void executeServerCall(HttpURLConnection connection)
                       throws IOException
        Description copied from class: OutMessage
        The logic to make a request to the server and getting the response/headers back from the server should be done in this method. The implementation would depend upon the method type using which the request has to be made to the server.
        Note: Different subclass implementations can throw the below exceptions
        Specified by:
        executeServerCall in class OutMessage
        Parameters:
        connection - the HttpURLConnection connection object using which the call needs to be made to the server
        Throws:
        IOException - there was an i/o error at the time of connecting with the server or some error at the time of reading the input data

      • getRequestMethod

        public String getRequestMethod()
        Specified by:
        getRequestMethod in class OutMessage
        Returns:
        the string representation of the request method supported by the instance that implements this method. It can be one of the values
        • GET
        • POST
        • PUT
        • DELETE

      • handleResponse

        public boolean handleResponse()
                       throws InvalidResponseCodeException
        Description copied from class: OutMessage
        Handle the response returned for a particular OutMessage instance.
        Specified by:
        handleResponse in class OutMessage
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating whether the response was handled completely or no
        Throws:
        InvalidResponseCodeException - if the response code returned by the server for this message is invalid

      • isValidCallback

        public boolean isValidCallback(BaseCallback callback)
        Specified by:
        isValidCallback in class Message
        Parameters:
        callback - an instance of BaseCallback
        Returns:
        a boolean value. true if the instance passed is either PostMessageCallback or RedirectionCallback.
